definition: with all one's might/with sudden force/violently/to slam

sentences.english: He crashed the glass against the wall.
sentences.chinese: 他把玻璃猛力地向牆上摔赴。

sentences.english: He jabbed a spear into the wild animal.
sentences.chinese: 他將長矛猛力刺進那頭野獸。

sentences.english: He jammed the receiver down on the cradle.
sentences.chinese: 他把聽筒猛力往支架上放下。

sentences.english: It assailed her with all the violence of her fervid imagination.
sentences.chinese: 它以那種她熱情想象的全部猛力襲擊着她。

sentences.english: He parted the rock with a mighty blow of the hammer.
sentences.chinese: 他用錘猛力一擊，把石頭敲碎了。

sentences.english: With a violent twist, he wrenched off the handle.
sentences.chinese: 他猛力一擰，將那把手擰了下來。

sentences.english: He swatted a fly that was annoying him.
sentences.chinese: 他猛力拍打一隻攪得他心煩的蒼蠅。

sentences.english: Only by yanking the door will you get it to open.
sentences.chinese: 只有猛力拉門才能打開這扇門。

sentences.english: Then he proceeded to slam me into the wall.
sentences.chinese: 接着，他向前走把我猛力地推到牆上。

sentences.english: With a violent twist, he wrenched off the handle .
sentences.chinese: 他猛力一擰，將那把手擰了下來。

sentences.english: He pushed back his chair so hard that it fell over .
sentences.chinese: 他猛力往後推他的椅子，結果椅子倒了。

sentences.english: He shut the door with a bang, to show that he was not afraid.
sentences.chinese: 他猛力關上門，顯示出他不怕的樣子。

definition: to swing (one's arms, a heavy object)/to wave (a sword, one's fists)/to fling (money)
to shake/to fling one's arm/to lash/to swing
(idiom) no sooner said than done/before you know it
pinyin: shuo1 shi2 chi2 , na4 shi2 kuai4
